result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ayeshia D Riley

records.addlTxt: Jury status hearing on December 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
State's Witness List.
Jury status hearing on December 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury status hearing on December 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Trial Order signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow 08/03/2022.

Jury status hearing on December 9, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on December 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

09:41 AM Defendant Ayeshia D Riley in court with attorney Paul Garland Bonneson.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.

Judge Carter is covering case for Judge Dorow. 

Atty Bonneson has received discovery and an offer. Atty Bonneson requests a jury trial after Defendant has her child in November. Court sets.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Letter to Judge Dorow regarding why investigator is needed in the case.

  **Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 07/19/22--Request approved without a hearing.**

LF 7/19--advised parties by email.

Letter filed by the State requesting the victim be allowed to appear by Zoom.

  **Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 07/06/22--Approved.**

to the Court filed by Atty. Paul Bonneson requesting to hire private investigator.

  **Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 06/27/22--Before the Court approves, the Defense must state why an investigator is needed, the reason for 35 hours and whether Ms. Riley agrees to be responsible for repayment of the costs associated with the investigator.**

LF 6/27--advised parties by email.
Hearing on August 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.

09:31 AM Defendant Ayeshia D Riley in court with attorney Paul Garland Bonneson.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Abigail Kincheloe, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense has received discovery, but not an offer.
Atty Bonneson requests that he be able to hire an investigator.
The Court requires that a document be filed with specifics as listed on the record.
  Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on June 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

09:28 AM Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Ayeshia D Riley in court with attorney Paul Garland Bonneson.  

Defense wishes to proceed to a preliminary hearing.  
Menomonee Falls Police Department Sergeant Matthew Meinel sworn in and testified on direct by Attorney Woller.  
Cross examination by Attorney Bonneson.
No further questions and the witness is excuted.

State rests and moves for bind over.
Defense moves to dismiss with no further argument.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 6, 2022 at 09:15 am.

10:32 AM Defendant Ayeshia D Riley in court with attorney Paul Garland Bonneson.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court conducts a prelim waiver with the Defendant.
The Defendant does not wish to waive at this time.
The Court will set the matter for prelim hearing.
Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Hearing on March 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Witness A/Menomonee Falls Health Center listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to be working in the capacity as a nurse.

Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $60.00 per month commencing April 1, 2022. (BC)

LF 3/15--mailed copy of order and payment letter to defendant.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 08:51 AM Defendant Ayeshia D Riley in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  The Court takes a short recess at 8:53 AM.  Matter recalled at 9:16 AM with the same appearances.  Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $60.00 per month commencing April 1, 2022.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  The Court will allow for the defendant to appear by Zoom at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 02/23/2022.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
